requirement_designation: Science, Nature and Technology with Lab
class_notes:
You must have permission to enroll in-person
In this laboratory students will continue to develop expertise in carrying out chemical reactions as they apply to the synthesis of organic and inorganic compounds. Students will use analytical methods to determine whether a chemical reaction has occurred or not, and will continue to develop expertise in the isolation and purification of products from reaction mixtures. In this laboratory students will continue to use spectroscopy as the main tool in the characterization of products from chemical reactions.
course_description: Chem 203zL introduces more sophisticated methods for studying the reactivity of compounds. The preparation and structure elucidation of organic and organometallic compounds will be studied in the context of a research lab type setting.
prerequisites: CHEM 202ZL as prerequisite and CHEM 203Z as co-requisite or equivalent transfer credit.
